p: To the best of our knowledge, there is only one study focusing on the antibacterial effect of the H. persicum EO, describing that H. persicum EO has some antimicrobial effects against Escherichia coli and Campylobacter jejuni by agar disc diffusion and microdilution assays [ 27]. The antimicrobial effect of Heracleum thomsonii against fungi, and Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria was also evaluated, and a strong antibacterial effect of H. thomsonii was reported, which could be due to the presence of significant amounts of different compositions such as “nerol” (87.9%) and “neryl acetate” (62.51%) [ 28].
